channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14290] Spin up less threads in tests
item.description:
TestDistributedLogReplay runs with > 450 threads which seems a little OTT (I get OOME, cannot create native thread when I run test suite on local MBP).

This issue is about trying to tamper down the tests that are using so many threads they can OOME because can't create native thread.
item.summary: Spin up less threads in tests

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12751855/lessthreads.txt
against master branch at commit 72f748f8b05e64c03ab296f76fd8e87fb4252acd.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12751855

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/15227//console

This message is automatically generated.
Does TestDistributedLogSplitting still need that many threads? I'm hoping that HBASE-14239 could have helped.
Working on it. HBASE-13480 will help TDLS in particular. Let me update this patch now it went in.

Lets try this patch.

Watching TDLS, it can spin up 1200+ threads during a run. With this patch in place, it almost goes to 800 (two masters and 6 regionservers – but still....) so a bit better but more work to do.

This message is automatically generated.

The failures are unrelated. I made HBASE-14304 for case where test fails to start because of a bind exception and the other failures are mapreduce xml parse.

Any chance of a +1?

Sets threads per server run in a test down from defaults of 30, etc., to be 3. Also removes places where we were bumping up priority queues to 40 per regionserver; now priority threads are 5.

+1

  • Nit: On commit can you fix the comment in TestDistributedLogSplitting to say the correct number of rs's
What I applied to master, branch-1, branch-1.2 and branch-1.1 (includes addressing Elliott comment)
What I applied to branch-1.0. Just the changes in the test hbase-site.xml because most of the other files changed are not in this branch.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment

There is a load more work to be done in here but enough for now Enis Soztutar Resolving.

Doing a manual git bisect – the test passes but leaves around a zombie – I find this commit as responsible for zombifying TestWithDisabledAuthorization on branch-1. Seems fine on master.
